questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the first three pairs of digits in a MAC address?

choices.A: defines packet forwarding priority sent or received by the adapter
choices.B: defines a routing identifier for the client
choices.D: indicates the IP address of the client in Hex
choices.C: indicates vendor of the network card or adapter

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C
Very easy
C is correct

questions.question_text: What are two benefits of using VLANs? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: B & C ok.

Selected Answer: BE
\router segments the broadcast domains.

Selected Answer: BC
B and C makes more sense

comments.content:
Actually if you connect 2 switches on a flat network (no vlans) the broadcast domain is all ports on both switches but if you put only one port on each switch on a different vlan (assuming trunk is configured) the broadcast domain is only two ports. 

That is actually segmentation so...
B&C are ok

Reduce the size broadcast domain
Increase the number of broadcast domains (no confuse with extends the size)
B and C are correct

discussion.content:
B and E
A. limits the devices that can join the network - Nope..
B. enables the logical grouping of devices that belong to different Layer 2 devices - Correct
C. segments the broadcast domain - Nope, a VLAN is a logical broadcast domain
 D. allows all network devices to be accessible from any host on the network - Nope
 E. extends the broadcast domain - Correct, VLANs logically extend broadcast domains across L2 devices

choices.D: allows all network devices to be accessible from any host on the network
choices.B: enables the logical grouping of devices that belong to different Layer 2 devices
choices.A: limits the devices that can join the network

discussion.content: C and D are correct

Selected Answer: DE
answer should be D,E
longest prefix rules out everything
then comes administrative distance

comments.content: I see what you guys are saying but if you have two exact same mask it doesn't matter, it takes the prefix not the mask itself (even when it depends on the mask)

Correct, you are good, but where does It says the longest prefix rules out everything in the question? . The most logical AD-> determine how install the routes the router, next it uses the metric values lower

discussion.content: The key of this question is to know that the term "best route" is applied between the same route with exact mask/prefix, so "longest match" doesn't apply here. C and D are the ones I go.

Selected Answer: CD
I thunk it should be C and D. It asks 'best route'. Subnet mask/longest prefix is manadatory criteria to determine the route itself, but after that to determine best route, it should be AD and metric.

Selected Answer: DE
Answers D and E.
Subnet mask and AD are used for considering the best route towards a destination.
Metrics play a role for each routing protocol separately, the route is either installed or not installed into routing table based on its metric. It doesn't play any role for choosing the best route when forwarding a packet.

comments.content: No the Subnet mask has nothing to do with "best route" the subnet mask is used byt the local host only, to determine IF the destination is on the same subnet or not. That is all.

discussion.content:
The route selection process is as follows:
1. longest match (smallest subnet mask)
2. lowest AD
3. lowest Metric

Selected Answer: CD
C & D are correct

Selected Answer: CD
A router o switch3 use AD to selecting the source of routing what it'll install in the routing table, later it use the value of metric to selecting the best route when forward the packets.
El package with the IP address that has the best match will fordward to out interface

Netmask is use to determinate if the hosts are in the same network o diferents networks.

So C: metrics and D. administrative distance are corrects

comments.content:
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/ip/enhanced-interior-gateway-routing-protocol-eigrp/8651-21.html
The main considerations while building the routing table are:
 Administrative distance 
 Metrics 
 Prefix length

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Stupid answers.
B and E are also used for selecting the best route.
If they mean routes for routing table, then C and D

C D

I see what you guys are saying but if you have two exact same mask it doesn't matter, it takes the prefix not the mask itself (even when it depends on the mask)
What about Longest prefix match? Subnet mask matter in the decision..
